intro: Palicourea gachetaensis, commonly known as Gacheta's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, specifically found in the Amazon rainforest regions of Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Palicourea gachetaensis is often found growing in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
